text:
CHAPTER 1-10
SECTION  IN  GENERAL
1-10-1
GENERAL PENALTY
Excepting in cases where a different penalty is imposed by this code or by some existing
provision of law, every violation of any of the provisions of this Code shall be punished
in accordance with the applicable provisions of the law of the State of South Dakota.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1997 Revision:  1990 Revisions
SDCL § 9-19-3
Cross References:
SDCL 9-19-3
Ordinance 261, 3/4/97                       
1-10-2
CONFLICTING ORDINANCES REPEALED
All ordinances and parts of ordinances in conflict with the provisions of this 1990
revision, or relating to the subject matter of this revision in general, but not re-enacted
as part thereof, excepting as stated in this Chapter, are hereby repealed:  provided,
however, that nothing herein shall be construed as repealing any special ordinances,
appropriation ordinances, franchise ordinances, levying ordinances for the issuance of
bonds, or other special ordinances of like character; nor shall this revision repeal or
modify the provisions of any resolution heretofore adopted by the City of Brandon unless
provisions of this revision in effect, either modify, repeal or amend. 
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
SDCL § 9-19-17.
                                                 
1-10-3
PUBLICATION AND EFFECT
This revision shall take effect immediately upon its adoption and complete publication
of the notice of such adoption as provided by Section 9-19-17 of the South Dakota
Codified Laws, or acts amendatory thereto.
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
SDCL § 9-19-17.
1-10-4
UNCONSTITUTIONALITY
Should any section, paragraph, sentence, clause or phrase of this revision be declared
unconstitutional or invalid for any reason, the remainder shall not be affected thereby. 
Legislative History:
1990 Revisions.
1-10-5
CITATION OF CODE
This revision may be cited as the "1990 Municipal Code," or "The Brandon Code." 
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
SDCL § 9-16-3.

1-10-6
SEVERABILITY
If any section of this 1990 Municipal Code is declared unconstitutional or the
application thereof to any person or circumstances held invalid by a court of competent
jurisdiction, the constitutionality of the remainder of the 1990 Municipal Code and
applicability thereof to other persons or circumstances shall not be affected. 
Legislative History:
Authority:
1990 Revisions.
SDCL § 9-19-3.
